6700.name: The Highland Trail
6700.description:
The forest gives way to rocky, windswept terrain as the trail climbs
eastward into the highlands. Loose scree crunches underfoot, and hardy
scrub grass clings to crevices between the stones. The air is thinner
here, carrying the scent of wild thyme and distant smoke.

west.description: The trail descends west into the forest.

6701.name: Windswept Ridge
6701.description:
A long ridge of exposed rock stretches east and west, buffeted by
relentless wind. The views are spectacular — to the west, endless
forest; to the east, a landscape of rocky plateaus and deep ravines.
A cairn of stacked stones marks the trail here.

west.description: The trail descends toward the forest.

south.description: A steep path descends toward the coast.

6702.name: The Ruined Watchtower
6702.description:
The crumbling remains of a stone watchtower perch on the ridge's highest
point. Only two walls still stand, but the view from here is commanding.
Scorch marks and old arrow holes tell of a violent end to whatever
garrison once manned this post. A rusty iron ladder leads up to what
remains of the second floor.

up.description: A rusty ladder leads to the upper floor.

extra_descs.scorch marks arrows: The tower was attacked from the east. Whatever came over the highlands hit this watchtower first.

6703.name: Cliffside Path
6703.description:
The path narrows dramatically, clinging to the face of a sheer cliff.
To your left, a wall of stone rises vertically; to your right, a
sickening drop into a boulder-strewn ravine far below. The wind
tugs at your clothing, and loose pebbles skitter over the edge
into the void.

west.description: The path widens near the watchtower.

6704.name: The Highland Crossroads
6704.description:
The cliffside path opens onto a rocky plateau where several trails
converge. A battered signpost stands at the center, surrounded by
the remains of old campfires. To the north, a dark trail leads toward
an ominous structure on a distant hilltop. To the southeast, the land
grows darker and more desolate.

west.description: The cliffside path clings to the cliff face.

north.description: A dark trail leads toward the monastery.

southeast.description: The path descends toward shadow-shrouded lands.

south.description: A narrow trail descends toward the southern coast.

extra_descs.signpost sign:
The signpost reads:
  NORTH - Haunted Monastery (cursed ground!)
  SOUTHEAST - Shadowspire Citadel (certain death)
  WEST - The Ridge / Northern Wilderness
  SOUTH - Coastal Path to the Sunken Coast

6705.name: The Dark Trail
6705.description:
The trail narrows as it climbs toward a looming structure silhouetted
against grey clouds. Dead trees line the path, their bare branches
reaching like skeletal fingers. An unnatural chill seeps from the
ground, and no birds sing here. Faded prayer ribbons hang from the
branches, their blessings long spent.

south.description: The trail returns to the crossroads.

north.description: The trail leads toward the monastery gates.

6706.name: Before the Monastery Gates
6706.description:
Massive iron gates stand before you, hanging askew on rusted hinges.
Beyond them, the dark silhouette of the Haunted Monastery rises against
the sky. A cold wind moans through the gate bars, carrying whispers
that might be words — or might be your imagination. The ground is
barren and cracked, as if the very earth recoils from this place.

south.description: The dark trail leads away from the monastery.

north.description: The gates lead into the Haunted Monastery.

6707.name: Highland Scrubland
6707.description:
Low, tough shrubs and wind-blasted grass cover this stretch of highland.
Rabbit warrens dot the ground, and a hawk circles lazily overhead. The
terrain is uneven but not treacherous, offering good visibility in all
directions. Stone outcroppings provide shelter from the worst of the wind.

north.description: The trail leads north to the crossroads.

6708.name: Southern Descent
6708.description:
The highland trail begins a steep descent southward. The air grows
warmer and more humid, carrying the faint salt tang of the sea. Rocky
terrain gradually gives way to sandy soil and coastal grasses. Seabirds
wheel overhead, their cries echoing off the cliff faces.

north.description: The trail climbs back up to the ridge.

south.description: The path descends to the Sunken Coast.

6709.name: The Blighted Path
6709.description:
The landscape grows increasingly desolate as the path winds southeast.
The grass is grey and brittle, the rocks stained with dark streaks.
An oppressive atmosphere presses down, and shadows seem to move
independently of the feeble light. Something deeply wrong pervades
this place.

northwest.description: The path returns to the highland crossroads.

southeast.description: The blighted path continues toward darkness.

6710.name: The Shadow Approach
6710.description:
Dark spires pierce the perpetually overcast sky ahead. The citadel of
Shadowspire looms in the distance, its impossible architecture defying
reason. The path here is lined with blackened pillars inscribed with
glyphs that seem to writhe when viewed from the corner of your eye.

northwest.description: The blighted path leads back to the highlands.

east.description: The path leads to the citadel gates.

6711.name: Before Shadowspire Citadel
6711.description:
The gates of Shadowspire Citadel rise before you, forged from some metal
blacker than iron. Tendrils of shadow seep from the gaps between the
massive doors, pooling on the ground like dark fog. The temperature drops
sharply here, and your breath mists in the unnatural cold. Beyond these
gates lies one of the most feared places in the realm.

west.description: The shadow approach leads back to the highlands.

north.description: The black gates lead into Shadowspire Citadel.

6712.name: Watchtower Upper Floor
6712.description:
What remains of the tower's second floor is little more than a stone
platform open to the sky. The view is extraordinary — you can see for
miles in every direction. An old spyglass, green with verdigris, is
mounted on a swivel bracket, still pointing east toward the dark lands.

extra_descs.spyglass:
Through the spyglass you can make out the dark spires of Shadowspire far
to the east, and closer, the crumbling monastery on its lonely hill.

6713.name: Narrow Coastal Descent
6713.description:
A narrow switchback trail descends the southern face of the highlands.
The rock is slick with sea spray carried on the wind, and hardy coastal
plants cling to every ledge. Far below, you can see the glittering
expanse of the sea and a strip of rocky coastline.

north.description: The trail climbs back up to the crossroads.

south.description: The trail continues down to the coastal path.

6700.name: highland raider
6700.long_desc: A fierce highland raider stands here, weapons drawn.
6700.description:
This raider wears fur-lined leather armor and carries a notched battle axe.
Blue woad tattoos cover exposed skin, and cold eyes assess you as either
threat or prey.

6701.name: mountain lion
6701.long_desc: A sleek mountain lion crouches on a rocky ledge, tail twitching.
6701.description:
A tawny mountain lion with powerful haunches and razor-sharp claws. It
watches you with predatory patience, muscles coiled to spring.

6702.name: harpy
6702.long_desc: A harpy perches on a rock outcropping, shrieking at passersby.
6702.description:
This wretched creature has the body of a giant vulture and the twisted
face of a woman. Its feathers are matted with filth, and its talons
are stained dark with old blood.

6703.name: highland hermit
6703.long_desc: A weathered hermit sits cross-legged on a flat stone, watching the world.
6703.description:
This old hermit has lived in the highlands for decades. His skin is
leathered by wind and sun, but his eyes are sharp and knowing. He
seems willing to share wisdom with respectful travelers.

6704.name: raider chieftain
6704.long_desc: The highland raider chieftain stands here, a massive figure draped in furs.
6704.description:
The chieftain is enormous, standing a full head taller than most warriors.
Scars crisscross his arms and face, each one a badge of survival. A
necklace of teeth and bones rattles at his chest.

6700.name: highland battle axe
6700.description: A heavy battle axe with a notched iron head and leather-wrapped haft.
